headline.main: EXTRA SESSION IN APRIL.; The President Wants Tariff Revised to Increase Revenues.

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.abstract: Walcott ordered sold; W. C. Dewey sued
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6. -- That the conference of Republican Senators and Representatives at the White House to-day will consider the question of an extra session to revise the tariff seems probable.
docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6. -- That the conference of Republican Senators and Representatives at the White House to-day will consider the question of an extra session to revise the tariff seems probable....

headline.main: A NEW $2,000,000 HOTEL; Col. Astor to Erect Building at 55th Street and 5th Avenue. Property Already Leased for a Period of Twenty Years, with Privilege of Three Renewals.

keywords.name: glocations
keywords.value: NEW YORK. MISCELLANY, CHURCHES, EXCHANGES, HOTELS, SOCIETIES

docs.abstract: Astor to Build at Fifth Avenue and Fifty-eighth Street; Property Leased to Rudolph M. Haan
docs.lead_paragraph: Excavation was begun yesterday morning on the property at the southeast corner of Fifth Avenue and Fifty-fifth Street, preparatory to the erection there of what it is believed will be the finest apartment hotel in this city, if not in the world. Col. John Jacob Astor will build on this site a sixteen-story structure, having a frontage of 75 feet on Fifth Avenue and 150 feet on Fifty-fifth Street.
docs.snippet: Excavation was begun yesterday morning on the property at the southeast corner of Fifth Avenue and Fifty-fifth Street, preparatory to the erection there of what it is believed will be the finest apartment hotel in this city, if not in the world. C...

headline.main: PLANS FOR BIG "SPITE WALL."; Mrs. R. Scanlon May Build a Seven-Story Brick Fence Up Against the Post-Graduate Hospital.

keywords.name: glocations
keywords.value: NEW YORK.--MISCELLANY - CHURCHES - EXCHANGES, HOTELS, REAL ESTATE, SOCIETIES

docs.lead_paragraph: Another "spite wall" will soon be erected if the plans filed yesterday at the Building Department are carried out. The owner with a grievance is Mrs. R. Scanlon, who owns and lives in the house at 302 East Twenty-first Street, and her grievance is against the Post-Graduate Hospital, which building stands on a large plot at the northeast corner of Second Avenue and Twentieth Street.

headline.main: THIRTEENTH REGIMENT SOLDIERS.; Reception, Drill, Review, and Dance of the Second Battalion.

docs.lead_paragraph: The members of Companies A, B, F, G, and K, constituting the Second Battalion of the Thirteenth Regiment, Brooklyn, gave a Christmas reception in the Flatbush Avenue armory last evening. The building was crowded with the militiamen and their friends.

headline.main: IN THE REAL ESTATE FIELD.; The Hotel Casa Alameda Sold -- Other Offerings at Auction.

docs.lead_paragraph: Among the property which came up for sale under foreclosure proceedings at 111 Broadway yesterday was the unfinished Hotel Casa Alameda, at the junction of the Boulevard, Columbus Avenue, and Sixty-third Street. The Brush Brothers began and nearly completed the structure, when their funds gave out and the financial stringency arose.

headline.print_headline: Hotel That Inspired ‘The Shining’ Builds on Its Eerie Appeal
headline.main: Hotel That Inspired ‘The Shining’ Builds on Its Eerie Appeal

docs.abstract: Colorado's Stanley Hotel featured in 1980 Stanley Kubrick film The Shining, based on Stephen King novel, adds miniature hedge maze to invoke one used in film's final scenes and fulfill expectations of tourists who flock there; competition for commission won by New York designer Miriam Dakllaryan Standing.
docs.lead_paragraph: The owner of the Stanley Hotel, where Stephen King had a nightmare in 1974 that inspired his novel, built a labyrinth in homage to the one used in the film.
docs.snippet: The owner of the Stanley Hotel, where Stephen King had a nightmare in 1974 that inspired his novel, built a labyrinth in homage to the one used in the film....
